info.name: OneBill Developer Guide
info.description:
OneBill Developer Guide can be used by a technical user who is intending to integrate their existing business applications with OneBill using an API (Application Programming Interface).

This is developer's guide to integrating with OneBill with REST web services. The documentation contains the list of the various _**REST API**_ across the different functional modules offered by OneBill.

# Authentication

OneBill uses OAuth for authenticating a user to access the API. An access token must be generated in order to utilize the OneBill REST web services.

**Original Request URL**

``` ruby
NOTE: Do a POST request for the following URL.

 ```

``` javascript
https://www....com/oauth/token?grant_type=password&client_id=<TenantID>&client_secret=<client_secret>&username=<username>&password=<hashed_password>&scope=trust

 ```

**Request Parameter Description**

The following are descriptions of the parameters which appear in the aforementioned URL.

- **client_id**: (Check your welcome pack email notification for the Tenant ID or contact your OneBill onboarding executive for the same).
- **client_secret**: You can find the client id and the client secret in the Business Profile section of the application. Click here to learn more about it.
- **username**: This is the username for a particular tenant.
- **hashed_password**: This is the password for the account in the encoded format. It should be encoded using the "ShaPasswordEncoder256"
    

# Prerequisite Headers

The following headers need to be added prior to consuming any of the RESTful APIs.

| Header | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Authorization | Bearer **access_token** |
| Content-Type | application/json |
| Accept | application/json |

# Proxy Information

OneBill supports a Channel Management module to let a business expand their business through channel partners. When a user wants to manage data under a partner, the proxy information is provided as part of the header. This enables the user to perform the operation as a Channel Partner would do it from the user interface, by using a single login created at the top level or the provider level. This avoids using different logins for each partner from the API route if the main business were to manage the operations on behalf of their partner through APIs.

Users must pass the following header details along with the other headers mentioned in the "Prerequisite Headers" section, as part of the URL, without the double quotes (""). This proxy header must ONLY be passed for APIs which support the proxy functionality.

- **Header**: "proxy_accountNumber"
- **Value**: "Partner's account number"

Create Products

header.description: Generate and pass the `access token` here.

request.description:
This section lists and explains the various URL and data parameters which are present in this Create a Product API.

It also contains the complete JSON request that can be used to Create a Product.

### Data Parameters

Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter in the link provided below.  
[Data Parameters.]()

Create a recurring product with a one-time installation charge.

For example, an recurring internet connection with a one-time WiFi router purchase.

### Data Parameters

Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter in the link provided below. [Data Parameter.]()

request.description:
Use this API payload request to create a product with a 24-month term.

When this product is purchased, a new subscription will be created for the end customer with a 24-month term.

If the "termAction" value is not passed, then the subscription will be cancelled at the end of the term.

### Data Parameters

Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter in the link provided below. [Data Parameters.]()

request.description:
Use this API request to create a taxable product in the system. This request will allow you to add a tax code to the product. The taxation being done here is with the help of the OneBill Internal Taxation feature. ### Reference APIs Use the following APIs to gather details that would be needed for the "Taxable Product" API.

  • Fetch Tax Codes: This API will help retrieve the tax codes that are present in the system.

### Data Parameters Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter in the link provided below. [Data Parameters.]()

request.description:
Use this API request to create a product with multiple price plans.

For example, a smartphone product may have a 64 GB variant and a 126 GB variant.

In this request, the 2 price plans contain 2 different type of charges, namely One-Time and a Recurring charge.

item.name: Fetch All Partners (Partner Listing)

header.description: Provide the generated access token here.

request.description:
This section lists and explains the various URL and data parameters which are present in this API.
### URL Parameters NOTE: The following is the URL when using search criteria.
```javascript /rest/PartnerService/v1/partners?channelType=1003&searchBy=accountNumber&searchString=SR2402&ascending=true&startCount=0&resultCount=2 ```

| Parameter | Description | Allowed Values | Required | |:------------------------:|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:--------:| | `channelType`
[int] | Enter the channel type which you wish to list the results for. | - 1003: Use this for listing channel partners. This is the default value.
- 1005: Use this for listing agents. | | | `searchBy`
[string] | Enter the parameter based on which you wish to search and list the results. | - `accountNumber`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's account number.
- `companyName`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's company name.
- `firstName`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's first name.
- `lastName`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's last name.
- `email`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's email address.
- `city`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's city.
- `state`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's state.
- `country`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's country.
- `zipcode`: Pass this value if you wish to search by the partner's zip code. | | | `searchString`
[string] | Pass the exact search parameter value which you wish to find and list matching results for. | | | | `ascending`
[boolean] | Pass this value if you wish to sort the results in ascending order. | - true
- false | | | `startCount`
[int] | Pass the listing start count value in this field. | | | | `resultCount`
[int] | Pass the total number of list results which you wish to see. | | |
### Data Parameters Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter in the link provided below.
[Response Data Parameters](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1DDqoukA9uEX_iOpAOIK0kJOALuj8vkN0DMQ2xd_Mlfo/edit?usp=sharing)

item.description:
This API is used to search and list all partner accounts which are present in the system. NOTE:
  • This API supports proxy functionality as well.
  • During proxy, this API returns the list of all agents which are present under the proxied partner account.
  • During proxy, this API returns the list of all child partners, if Multi-Level Channel Management feature is enabled.

item.name: Search the Order using various parameters

request.description:
### URL Params  
Mandatory:

- **searchString** \- \[string\]: This is the field for giving the string which should be searched.
- **searchBy:** This is the field, based on what it has to be searched. list of supported parameter.
- **orderNumber:** The specific number allocated to the order.
- **AccountNumber:** The account number of the subscriber whose invoices we are fetching.
- **OrderName:** The order name can be also used in the search by
- **startCount:** \[int\]: The count with which the response must start with. The default value must be set to "0".  
    resultCount - \[int\]: This is the number of response elements which the response must show.
    

Optional:

- **orderBy** \- \[string\]: This determines what field of the output response must the entire response should be ordered with.
- **ascending** - \[boolean\]: This field is used to determine if the output should be displayed in ascending or not.

item.name: Modify Invoice
Regenerate an invoice and retain invoice number, due dates, and invoice date.

request.description:
This API is used to regenerate the invoice by retaining the information.

#### URL Params

invoiceNumber .\[string\]: This is the invoice number of the invoice which you wish to regenerate or rectify. {Mandatory}

#### Data Params

Mandatory:

- modificationType \[string\]: This field is used to state the type of modification that is being done on the invoice. The values can be as follows.  
    **regenerate**: If you wish to regenerate the invoice  
    **rectify**: If you wish to rectify the invoice
    

Optional:

- **retainInvoiceNumber** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the invoice number.
- **retainDueDates** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the due dates.
- **retainInvoiceDate** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the invoice date.

item.name: Rectify an invoice without retaining anything

request.description:
This API is used rectify the invoice without retaining any information.

#### URL Params

invoiceNumber .\[string\]: This is the invoice number of the invoice which you wish to regenerate or rectify. {Mandatory}

#### Data Params

Mandatory:

- modificationType \[string\]: This field is used to state the type of modification that is being done on the invoice. The values can be as follows.  
    **regenerate**: If you wish to regenerate the invoice  
    **rectify**: If you wish to rectify the invoice
    

Optional:

- **retainInvoiceNumber** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the invoice number.
- **retainDueDates** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the due dates.
- **retainInvoiceDate** \[boolean\]: Pass this field if you wish to retain the invoice date.

item.name: Fetch Grants list for an Account

request.description:
This API is used to fetching the list of Grants for particular subscriber account.

**Mandatory:**

- accountNumber = \[STRING\]
    - **Example:** SR1707

**Optional**:

- subscriptionIdentifier: Use this parameter if you wish to list grants based on a subscription identifier. For example, **/rest/SubscriberService/v1/subscribers//grants?detailed=true&subscriptionIdentifier=SUB-2230**
    

- grantName: Use this parameter if you wish to list grants based on a specific grant name. For example, **/rest/SubscriberService/v1/subscribers//grants?detailed=true&grantName=500GB**
- fromDate: Use this parameter if you wish to list grants based on effective from date.
- toDate: Use this parameter if you wish to list grants based on the effective to date.
- availableOn: Use this parameter if you wish to list grants based on the type of grant i.e. whether it is an account level grant or a subscription level grant.
- startCount: Enter the start count of the result.
- resultCount: Enter the total result count in this field.

item.name: Payments
Make Payment

header.description: Provide the generated access token in this field.

request.description:
This section lists and explains the various URL and data parameters which are present in this API.
### URL Parameters none
### Data Parameters Check out the field descriptions for each data parameter below.

Request Data Parameters | Parameter | Description | Allowed Values | Required | |-----------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------| | ```invoiceNumber```
[string] | This is the invoice number as available on the invoice. | | Y | | ```paymentMethod```
[string] | This is the payment method chosen for making the payment. | The values can be as follows.
1. CC
2. ECHECK
3. CASH
4. DIRECT DEBIT | Y | | ```paymentAmount```
[decimal] | This is the amount of payment being made against the invoice. | | Y | | ```description```
[string] | This is the payment description. | | | | ```paymentDate```
[date] | This is the date on which the payment was made. | | | | ```accountNumber```
[string] | This is the account number of the subscriber for whom the payment is being made. | | | | ```referenceNumber```
[string] | This is the reference number of the payment being made. | | |

item.description: This section will discuss the settings or the pre-requiste required to set-up a service desk ticketing feature.

Tickets or Service Requests can be used by a business to track any problems or requests from their cusotmers. APIs for ticket management would let the user create, view, edit a ticket. A ticket created / managed from API can be viewed from UI or vice versa.

The Service Desk APIs lets a user create, view and manage tickets in the OneBill application. The tickets created through APIs would be available in the UI and a ticket created via the UI can be managed from the APIs as well.

item.name: Create Rule

request.description: This API is used to create ticket rule with conditions and actions.

header.value: *, Content-Type, Pragma, Origin, Authorization, party, X-XSRF-TOKEN, X-Requested-With,Access-Control-Allow-Headers,Accept,Access-Control-Allow-Credentials,X-Auth-Token, version, cache

item.description: Create rule API would be used to create a new rule for the Service Desk ticket assignment. A rule can have one or more rulesets of conditions, that can be defined as part of the create API. A service desk rule would be evaluated at the time of ticket creation to set specific fields on the ticket.

Service Desk rule API would be used to manage the rules that is used for ticket assignment. A user can manage a rule which would be evaluated at the time of ticket creation to set relevant properties in the ticket or assign them to the right departments and users.
